message: You have entered the correct keyword

data.answer:
**Definition** : Cross-origin resource sharing (CORS) is a mechanism that allows restricted resources on a web page to be requested from another domain outside the domain from which the first resource was served.
 **MDN Documentation Link**:https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/CORS
 **RDS Documentation Link** : https://github.com/Real-Dev-Squad/docs/tree/main/docs/dev/https-dev-url-cors#readme

**Definition** : An API (Application Programming Interface) is a set of rules and protocols that allows different software applications to communicate and interact with each other.
 **MDN Documentation Link**:https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/JavaScript/Client-side_web_APIs/Introduction

**Definition** : JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) is a lightweight data-interchange format. It is easy for humans to read and write. It is easy for machines to parse and generate.
 **MDN Documentation Link**:https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/JavaScript/Objects/JSON
